page.title: 20KILNHURST HEALTH CENTRE
page.content: There is one health centre in Kilnhurst. It was built in 1963 and it is a wood and brick building. There is a shelter for the pushchairs and prams. The health visitors see about 40 babies on Thursday afternoons for weighing, injections and advice. The Health Centre is also used as a doctor's surgery and ante-natal clinic during the week, and as a chiropody clinic once a month. There are two health visitors, a district nurse, a midwife and a doctor, and a chiropodist visits once a month. The mothers who take their babies on a Thursday afternoon come from Kilnhurst village, Meadow View area, the Patios and some from Lime Grove. The mothers can buy milk, rusks and baby food at the clinic.
